intro: Conium ceretanum, commonly known as the lesser hemlock, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is a biennial or perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–80 cm. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in umbels. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in moist, shady habitats. Due to its toxic properties, it should be handled with care.
